When I buy a pair of headphones for £20 I know I'm not getting the cutting edge and flawless sound however I was pleasantly surprised by this nifty and very usable set from i21.I tend to use my headphones when I am out running and need some pounding motivational music and for longer business trips when a good audiobook is required. The i21 fits the bill for both admirably. While it might lack the top treble and deepest bass of some it's easily better than others I have tried at a similar price point. I could get some decent bass with disturbance the noise-canceling helps with that and the spoken word of audio books was clear and precise.After using these at least 4 or 5 times a week over the last three weeks I have noticed the comfort of wearing them and the snug fit straight out of the box of course this will vary for others and additional earpieces are included. I never once felt that I might lose them even when using the touch control. Speaking of which there is a large touch surface on each very useful and running or exercising and the easy interface quickly became second nature to use.Battery life was right up there with what was promised they lasted a full coach trip down to London and back a twelve-hour round trip but I did take a few breaks so the battery claims of up to eight hours seem to hold up. The noise canceling was very good too very useful on a crowded coach.Recharging over usb-c is quick too and the one-hour charge in ten minutes claim is also spot on.Answering calls is a simple one-touch matter and worked well no matter what I was doing.The case is compact and lightweight and can easily be slipped into a pocket or bag.

These arrived pretty quickly earlier than it said it would.  The earphones had a bit of plastic over the contacts so they wouldn't charge in transit but the box was nearly full at 97%. I then charged the earphones and it only took 5 or 10 minutes so they were mostly charged already.  Pairing with my PC and phone was easy just long press on both earphones before startup to enter pairing mode then just use your device to connect to them they are called i21.  I was impressed by the audio quality it seems to have a good amount of bass and midrange my previous earphones (cheaper than these) had too much bass which I didn't think was possible!  My other earphones didn't have enough bass - the Anker Soundcore Life P2.  These feel pretty comfortable and don't fall out due to the sports band.  I don't do any running with earphones but they always come out a bit and you have to push them in but I haven't needed to do that with these yet. The lid is magnetised so it stays shut the hinge could use a bit more resistance but it's nitpicking really.
